definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: About music, is clearly one of the characteristics of the Chuanqi art.
sentences.chinese: 讲究音律，显然是传奇艺术的特征之一。

sentences.english: The sound of Yeats was, and was meant to be, seductive.
sentences.chinese: 叶芝诗歌的音律是，也旨在达到诱惑性的目标。

sentences.english: What can you do with sound as interpreters?
sentences.chinese: 作为一个翻译，当你听到这样的音律你会怎么做？

sentences.english: The sound of the violin was just magnificent.
sentences.chinese: 小提琴的音律是那么华丽。

sentences.english: I think that word "see" deserves the accent there, and so it's--the first unit of sound isn't quite normative.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得“看“是重音，这是第一个音律不规则的地方。

sentences.english: Music has the charm to soothe a savage breast, but not the unmusical one.
sentences.chinese: 音乐能平息野蛮凶暴，对不通音律者却无能为力。

sentences.english: The melodies used in a given maqam aims effectively to express the emotional state of the reader throughout the set liturgy (without changing the text).
sentences.chinese: 音律旨在有效表达情感而不改变文字的意思。

sentences.english: Liu Wei courtyards and layout, but also voice, though covertly .
sentences.chinese: 而刘炜庭院里的布置，却也抑扬顿挫，暗合音律。

sentences.english: Let me go back to the sound of this work.
sentences.chinese: 再让我们看看这首诗的音律。

definition: music/rhyme and rhythm/initial, 音[yin1], and final and tone, 韻|韵[yun4], of a Chinese character/phoneme
the four arts (zither, Go, calligraphy, painting)/the accomplishments of a well-educated person
pre-Tang names of the five notes of the pentatonic scale, corresponding roughly to do, re, mi, sol, la
zither or guzheng/large zither with 13 to 25 strings, developed from guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] during Tang and Song times
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
qin and se, two string instruments that play in perfect harmony/marital harmony
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
